item.description:
CALENDAR OF TOPICS

3/16. Zen Path Through Depression III. How can you cope with negativity and despair through a committed spiritual practice. From the book by Philip Martin. Presented by Robert Orsi.



3/23. Higan: Day of Rededication to Practice. Also, Easter Sunday. Includes Touching of Earth Ceremony. Topic: Buddhism, Zen and Nembutsu. How is it that everything in life is religion - the Buddhist Way? How does Buddhism untangle the knots of human troubles? A look into the Beat generation. From the book Everyday Suchness by Goymay Kubose.


Visit our MAIN WEB SITE is at www. bffct.net


We practice quiet sitting meditation, sacred chants, and mindfulness. Includes lively discussions on the practical daily application of Buddhism. Open to all seekers of wisdom and compassion from beginners to the most advanced.

We meet on most Sunday mornings from 10 - 12:15 p.m. at the Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Connecticut. Google us, "Buddhist Faith Fellowship" for schedule, philosophy and directions.

Our group was established in 2001 with a Mahayana orientation, focusing on Shin Buddhism.

We have two local Affiliated Chapters:

SOUTHINGTON BUDDHIST FELLOWSHIP

http://southington.bf...

BUDDHA GAIA

http://buddhagaia.bff...


"Consider others as yourself"
-- the Buddha
item.how_to_find_us: 35 - 40 people attend. We are a friendly and warm community. You'll love the chanting, meditation and especially the insightful discussions.
item.why: Good reasons to attending? 1) practice oriented 2) friendly and like-minded people 3) practical discussions 4) social networking 5) courses available 6) Learn from certified teachers 7) Learn to calm the mind and open your heart 8) free of charge
